definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: Americans have always had an ambivalent attitude toward  intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 美國人對情報工作有種愛恨交織態度。

sentences.english: But the poll shows some ambivalence about Mr. Obama's economic prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 但調查顯示人們對奧巴馬挽救經濟的行動愛恨交織。

sentences.english: I have a love-hate relationship with white silk .
sentences.chinese: 我與白色的絲綢有一種愛恨交織的關係。

sentences.english: Since the invention of high heels, women have been its love-hate intertwined.
sentences.chinese: 自從高跟鞋發明以來，女性一直對它愛恨交織。

sentences.english: Presidents have long had a love-hate relationship with teleprompters. Harry S.
sentences.chinese: 總統與視讀儀之間漫長的感情可以用愛恨交織來形容。

sentences.english: Most students have had a love-hate experience or full-blown relationship with procrastination.
sentences.chinese: 大多數學生和拖延症的關係可謂愛恨交織，纏綿悱惻。

sentences.english: We will change into a love to hate the tears of the intertexture .
sentences.chinese: 我們將轉變爲愛恨交織的淚水。

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to have no sense of shame/brazen
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
